content: Bank Account Savings Asked by AnonymousAsked on 26 May 2019I need to pay my kids school fees twice a year. So I usually put aside an amount every month. Is there any account that is preferred for this type of movement other than my regular savings account? My intention is that i get some kind of minimal interest and I also don't use that money till I need to pay the fees. Which is every 6 months.1 answerAnswerBump0

Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 27 May 2019High interest savings account like DBS multiplier, UOB One etc are good. If you have already maxed out those type of account, you can try CIMB Fast saver, recently they have increased the interest rates to 1.5% for above $50k.6 Months is a really short time for most Fixed deposits. Though you can try Singapore savings bonds but take note there is a 1 month withdrawal time required so it might be even more inconvenient to move the funds around.0 comments0
